Iron deficiency anaemia due to chronic bleeding is very rare. Another cause must first be ruled out before attributing it to haemorrhoids. Cf [[2C-355|i''tem digestive haemorrhage 355''']]

question.title: What should be ruled out before attributing iron deficiency anaemia to chronic bleeding from haemorrhoids?
question.description: Iron deficiency anaemia due to chronic bleeding is very rare. Another cause must first be ruled out before attributing it to haemorrhoids.

option_a.title: Other types of anaemia
option_a.description: A common cause of iron deficiency anaemia that should be ruled out

option_b.title: Haemorrhoids other than internal
option_b.description: Haemorrhoids that are not internal in nature

option_c.title: Gastrointestinal bleeding from other sources
option_c.description: Bleeding from other sources such as ulcers or cancer

option_d.title: Thalassemia
option_d.description: A genetic disorder affecting haemoglobin production
